conclusion: Light source is positioned in front of the objects, casting shadows behind them.
Shadow A is cast by the object closer to the edge of the surface.
Shadow B is cast by the smaller object, likely the ring.
Shadow C is cast by a larger, irregularly shaped object towards the center-left.
Shadow D is cast by an object near the postcard, possibly the top part of the postcard or a part of the cylindrical object.
If the light source moves to the left, shadows will move to the right.
Shadow A will move further to the right.
Shadow B will also shift further to the right.
Shadow C will shift to the right.
Shadow D will likely shift slightly to the right.
If the light source moves to the right, shadows will move to the left.
Shadow A will move further to the left.
Shadow B will also shift further to the left.
Shadow C will shift to the left.
Shadow D will likely shift slightly to the left.
Shadows A, B, and C will move horizontally to the opposite direction of the light source's movement.
Shadows could change shape due to the new angle of illumination.
If the light source moves significantly away, shadows might become smaller.
If the light source is close, shadows remain prominent and will not decrease in size unless the light source gets very low.
Moving the light source to the back left will result in shadows shifting to the right.
Moving the light source to the back right will result in shadows shifting to the left.
Both movements will not significantly change the size of the shadows but can alter their shape.
